scop 0.1.0
  • Reference

Color palettes collected in scop.

Source: R/themes.R
palette_scop.Rd

Color palettes collected in scop.

Usage

palette_scop(
  x,
  n = 100,
  palette = "Paired",
  palcolor = NULL,
  type = "auto",
  matched = FALSE,
  reverse = FALSE,
  NA_keep = FALSE,
  NA_color = "grey80"
)

Arguments

x

A vector of character/factor or numeric values. If missing, numeric values 1:n will be used as x.

n

The number of colors to return for numeric values.

palette

Palette name. All available palette names can be queried with show_palettes().

palcolor

Custom colors used to create a color palette.

type

Type of x. Can be one of "auto", "discrete" or "continuous". The default is "auto", which automatically detects if x is a numeric value.

matched

If TRUE, will return a color vector of the same length as x.

reverse

Whether to invert the colors.

NA_keep

Whether to keep the color assignment to NA in x.

NA_color

Color assigned to NA if NA_keep is TRUE.

See also

show_palettes palette_list

Examples

x <- c(1:3, NA, 3:5)
(pal1 <- palette_scop(
  x,
  palette = "Spectral"
))
#>    [1,1.04] (1.04,1.08] (1.08,1.12] (1.12,1.16]  (1.16,1.2]  (1.2,1.24] 
#>   "#5E4FA2"   "#5954A4"   "#555AA7"   "#5060AA"   "#4C66AC"   "#476BAF"

(pal2 <- palette_scop(
  x,
  palcolor = c("red", "white", "blue")
))

(pal3 <- palette_scop(
  x,
  palette = "Spectral",
  n = 10
))
#>   [1,1.4] (1.4,1.8] (1.8,2.2] (2.2,2.6]   (2.6,3]   (3,3.4] (3.4,3.8] (3.8,4.2] 
#> "#5E4FA2" "#3288BD" "#66C2A5" "#ABDDA4" "#E6F598" "#FFFFBF" "#FEE08B" "#FDAE61" 
#> (4.2,4.6]   (4.6,5] 
#> "#F46D43" "#D53E4F" 
(pal4 <- palette_scop(
  x,
  palette = "Spectral",
  n = 10,
  reverse = TRUE
))
#>   (4.6,5] (4.2,4.6] (3.8,4.2] (3.4,3.8]   (3,3.4]   (2.6,3] (2.2,2.6] (1.8,2.2] 
#> "#D53E4F" "#F46D43" "#FDAE61" "#FEE08B" "#FFFFBF" "#E6F598" "#ABDDA4" "#66C2A5" 
#> (1.4,1.8]   [1,1.4] 
#> "#3288BD" "#5E4FA2" 
(pal5 <- palette_scop(
  x,
  palette = "Spectral",
  matched = TRUE
))
#>  [1,1.04]  (1.96,2]  (2.96,3]      <NA>  (2.96,3]  (3.96,4]  (4.96,5] 
#> "#5E4FA2" "#83CDA4" "#FDFEBD"        NA "#FDFEBD" "#F88F52" "#9E0142" 
(pal6 <- palette_scop(
  x,
  palette = "Spectral",
  matched = TRUE,
  NA_keep = TRUE
))
#>  [1,1.04]  (1.96,2]  (2.96,3]      <NA>  (2.96,3]  (3.96,4]  (4.96,5] 
#> "#5E4FA2" "#83CDA4" "#FDFEBD"  "grey80" "#FDFEBD" "#F88F52" "#9E0142" 
show_palettes(
  list(pal1, pal2, pal3, pal4, pal5, pal6)
)

#> [1] "1" "2" "3" "4" "5" "6"

all_palettes <- show_palettes(return_palettes = TRUE)

names(all_palettes)
